snippet: The “Grow Italy” measures are designed to invigorate the economy, but critics said many of the bill’s changes had been watered down.
abstract: Italian Senate approves measures designed to invigorate the economy, but critics say that some proposals have been watered down, a sign of the roadblocks facing Prime Minister Mario Monti as he tries to turn around Italy’s stagnant economy.
lead_paragraph: The “Grow Italy” measures are designed to invigorate the economy, but critics said many of the bill’s changes had been watered down.

headline.main: Reform Bill Scaled Back as Italians Apply Politics
headline.print_headline: Reform Bill Scaled Back As Italians Apply Politics
